text: i'm neil genzlinger on the staff editor
at The New York Times and I was sent
down to orlando florida to look at the
wizarding world of harry potter at the
universal theme park
they opened the park on Memorial Day
weekend to a select group of people who
had bought a particular vacation package
I was there on that same weekend with my
ratty old home video camera my family
and I had gotten in there before they
had actually opened the place because
we're getting a press tour we were
sitting there sipping our butter beers
and suddenly they opened the gates and a
huge stampede of people came storming
right over top of us it was a little
frightening and a little amusing at the
same time
one of the high points of the park is
certainly Allah vanderzwaan shop which
has been recreated much like it looks in
the films I do let's see if we can
levitate just one of those red wall
boxes above there is an actor in there a
proprietor of the wand shop who invites
about 30 people into the shop at a time
and picks out one of them and it's
usually a small child one wand turns out
to be the right one and the kid walks
away in a in a beam of light
and then everyone is invited to step
through a doorway into an actual shop
where they can buy the ones you are here
for the won't we have probably spent 300
bucks in this place before we got out of
there between the $30 wand and the
thirty dollars sorting hat and the
endless supply of butterbeer that we
drank if you go you either got to be
prepared to spend a fair amount of money
or don't go with any money and save
yourself the temptation
ha
